properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 2 at 8:34PM EDT until April 2 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
properties.description:
At 834 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stanford,
moving northeast at 55 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to
roofs, siding, and trees.

Locations impacted include...
Stanford, Lancaster, Crab Orchard, Hustonville, Boneyville, Jumbo,
Mount Salem, Gilbert, Geneva, and Preachersville.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central
Kentucky.

Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

NWSheadline: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL LINCOLN AND SOUTH CENTRAL GARRARD COUNTIES

properties.areaDesc: Coshocton, OH; Guernsey, OH; Muskingum, OH; Noble, OH; Tuscarawas, OH
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 2 at 8:34PM EDT until April 2 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
SVRPBZ

The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Guernsey County in east central Ohio...
Southeastern Coshocton County in east central Ohio...
Northeastern Muskingum County in east central Ohio...
South central Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio...
North central Noble County in east central Ohio...

* Until 915 PM EDT.

* At 834 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from Dresden to North Zanesville to South Zanesville,
moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles. Trees snapped and uprooted.
Power outages.

* Locations impacted include...
Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, Byesville, Antrim,
Senecaville, Pleasant City, Conesville, Lore City, Old Washington,
Plainfield, Norwich, Chandlersville, Otsego, Birmingham, Boden,
Seneca Lake Park, Salt Fork State Park, and Kimbolton.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for east central
Ohio.

Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to
the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.

properties.areaDesc: Greenup, KY; Athens, OH; Gallia, OH; Jackson, OH; Lawrence, OH; Meigs, OH; Vinton, OH
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 2 at 8:32PM EDT until April 2 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
SVRRLX

The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
North central Greenup County in northeastern Kentucky...
Northwestern Meigs County in southeastern Ohio...
Northern Gallia County in southeastern Ohio...
Jackson County in southeastern Ohio...
Vinton County in southeastern Ohio...
Southwestern Athens County in southeastern Ohio...
Northwestern Lawrence County in southeastern Ohio...

* Until 915 PM EDT.

* At 831 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lucasville,
or 10 miles south of Waverly, moving northeast at 45 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Jackson, Wellston, Mcarthur, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Lake Hope State
Park, Gallia, South Shore, Hamden, Coalton, Zaleski, Vinton,
Wilkesville, Mabee, Creola, Radcliffe, Dyesville, Petersburg,
Allensville, and Salem Center.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to
flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northeastern
Kentucky...and southeastern Ohio.

IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines.

properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central
Ohio.

Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and
submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

NWSheadline: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS...SOUTHEASTERN PIKE AND NORTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES

properties.areaDesc: Carroll, OH; Harrison, OH; Jefferson, OH; Tuscarawas, OH
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 2 at 8:31PM EDT until April 2 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:

Freeport, moving northeast at 60 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind
damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power
outages.

Locations impacted include...
Cadiz, Freeport, Hopedale, Scio, Jewett, Bergholz, Amsterdam,
Richmond, Bowerston, Bloomingdale, Unionport, Tippecanoe, Piedmont,
Stillwater, Deersville, Clendening Lake, Kilgore, Harlem Springs,
Tappan Lake, and Leesville Lake Park.

SVRRLX

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage

Grayson, Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Princess, Coalton,
Denton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Naples, Rush, Carter,
Grahn, Hopewell, Hitchins, Warnock, Soldier, Globe, and Mavity.

185.
